page.title: 19CHAPELS IN TYDD ST.GILES.
page.content: There is one Noncomformist church in the village.It belongs to the Methodist movement,and was built in 1885.Several other Methodist chapels were built around our area at about the same time,so the Methodist church must have had a strong effect on the people then.Only one of those other chapels is still in use.The village chapel now has a service every Sunday, with about 20 people attending.The building is used by the village play group during the week.In the 18th century the Baptist Church began to meet in the village.The congregation was started by John Smith,the village shopkeeper.People were baptised in a pond,near the chapel,on Broadgate.More people went to the Baptist Chapel than to the parish church.The chapel was sold in 1922 and is now used as a barn.
